document_data.name: Barakuir
document_data.mainbody: '''Barakuir''', also known as the '''Iron Kingdom''', was a part of the [[dwarven]] realm of [[Shanatar]], dominated by the [[shield dwarf]] [[Clan Duergar]], whose inhabitants would eventually be transformed into the [[Duergar|gray dwarves]]. The kingdom venerated [[Laduguer]] and was ruled by a priest-king who was known as the Iron Shield.{{Cite dragon/267/The City of Sunken Spires|40}}
document_data.History:
Barakuir held fierce rivalries with the neighbouring sub-kingdoms of [[Drakkalor]] and [[Ultoksamrin]], which were converted to open conflict during the [[Spawn Wars]] from around {{Yearlink|-9000}}.

Barakuir swore its allegiance to the [[Wyrmskull Throne]] of Shanatar and fought in the [[Second Spider War]] from {{Yearlink|-8145}} to {{Yearlink|-8137}}. As it came to an end, Barakuir believed its king should have been the one selected to rule all of Shanatar, and when this did not happen, Barakuir's inhabitants became bitter and turned away from the other kingdoms of Shanatar.

Although many clans originally inhabited Barakuir, the ruling Clan Duergar became increasingly tyrannical, leading the other clans to flee.

Around {{Yearlink|-8100}}, the [[Mindstalker Wars]] between Shanatar and the [[illithid]]s of [[Oryndoll]] caused Barakuir to become cut off from the rest of Shanatar, preventing reinforcements from arriving. It was conquered by the illithids and its inhabitants were enslaved. In the millenia that followed, the inhabitants of Barakuir eventually became the [[Duergar|gray dwarves]], a distinct dwarven race.

Around {{Yearlink|-4000}}, the duergar of Barakuir rebelled against their slavers and liberated themselves. On acquisition of this freedom, the dwarves created new subterranean holdings in the [[Northdark|North Underdark]] underneath the [[Orsraun Mountains]], and also underneath the [[Great Glacier]].
